tool.name: @BINARY@
tool.description: find minimum cuts that correspond to boundaries
tool.command:
#if $mode.mode_selector == 'TAD_score': ln -s '$mode.matrix' matrix.npz.h5 && #end if
#if $mode.mode_selector == 'find_TADs': ln -s '$tad_score_zscore_matrix' ./tadScoreFile.tabular_zscore_matrix.h5 && #end if
hicFindTADs $mode.mode_selector
#if $mode.mode_selector == 'find_TADs': --tadScoreFile '$tadScoreFile' --outPrefix galaxy_tad_prefix ##--maxThreshold $mode.maxThreshold --delta $mode.delta --pvalue $mode.pvalue #if $mode.minBoundaryDistance: --minBoundaryDistance $mode.minBoundaryDistance #end if
#else: --matrix matrix.npz.h5 --maxDepth $mode.maxDepth --minDepth $mode.minDepth --outFileName ./tadScoreFile.tabular
--step $mode.step #end if

param.label: Minimum threshold of the difference between the TAD-separation score of a putative boundary and the mean of the TAD-sep. score of surrounding bins.
param.help: The delta value reduces spurious boundaries that are shallow, which usually occur at the center of large TADs when the TAD-sep. score is flat. Higher delta threshold values produce more conservative boundary estimations. By default, multiple delta thresholds are saved for the following delta values: 0.001, 0.01, 0.03, 0.05, 0.1. Other single or multiple values can be given.

param.label: P-value threshold
param.help: The probability of a local minima to be a boundary is estimated by comparing the distribution (Wilcoxon ranksum) of the zscores between the left and right regions (diamond) at the local minimum with the matrix zscores for a diamond at --minDepth to the left and a diamond --minDepth to the right. The reported pvalue is the Bonferroni correction all pvalues.

param.label: Minimum distance between boundaries (in bp).
param.help: This parameter can be used to reduce spurious boundaries caused by noise.

param.label: Corrected Hi-C matrix to use for the computations
Minimum window length (in bp) to be considered to the left and to the right of each Hi-C bin.
param.help: This number should be at least 3 times as large as the bin size of the Hi-C matrix.

param.label: Maximum window length (in bp) to be considered to the left and to the right of each Hi-C bin.
param.help: This number should around 6-10 times as large as the bin size of the Hi-C matrix.

param.label: Step size when moving from minDepth to maxDepth
param.help: The step size grows exponentially as `maxDeph + (step * int(x)**1.5) for x in [0, 1, ...]` until it reaches `maxDepth`. For example, selecting step=10,000, minDepth=20,000 and maxDepth=150,000 will compute TAD-scores for window sizes: 20,000, 30,000, 40,000, 70,000 and 100,000

data.name: score
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Matrix with multi-scale TAD scores

tool.help:
**What it does**
Uses the graph clustering measure "conductance" to find minimum cuts that correspond to boundaries.
